paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant p.(V142I) including penetrance data and patient demographics.

patients.demographics: Mean age 76.9 years, 86.4% male, predominantly Black ethnicity.
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin cardiac amyloidosis (hATTR-CA) with significant blood biomarker abnormalities.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac amyloidosis with elevated troponin levels.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The death rate was 19.7 deaths per 100 person-years (95% CI, 17.2–22.2) in the p.(V142I) hATTR‐CA group.

functional_data.summary: Patients with p.(V142I) hATTR-CA exhibited higher levels of NT-proBNP and troponin, indicating severe cardiac involvement.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families as indicated by the higher prevalence of symptoms in carriers.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with a higher mortality rate compared to other genotypes.
key_quotes: Anemia was most prevalent in p.(V142I) hATTR‐CA.
Patients with p.(V142I) hATTR‐CA had the highest median troponin-T level.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was primarily focused on the p.(V142I) variant in the TTR gene.
